title: Liverpool predicted line-up for Man Utd showdown at Old Trafford
text:

Liverpool head to Old Trafford as firm favourites for their crunch clash with rivals Man Utd on Sunday.

The Merseyside club top the table after eight wins from eight, and having earned 17 straight victories in the Premier League.

A win over the Red Devils would see Liverpool equal Man City's record, but they've not beaten United on away soil in five years.

They have a huge opportunity with two key first-team stars back from injury, while United have a number of players missing.

Alisson is expected to feature for the first time since the opening day win over Norwich having recovered from a calf problem.

(Image: Liverpool FC via Getty Images)

The Brazilian stopper has been adequately covered by understudy Adrian, but looks set to regain his no.1 spot for the trip to United.

In front of him the Reds are likely to return to their familiar back four, with Joel Matip fit again after a recent knock which kept him out of the win over Leicester .

That means Dejan Lovren, who deputised so well for the Cameroonian, will either drop to the bench or out of the squad entirely, with Joe Gomez also in contention.

There were also fitness doubts over Mohamed Salah after he suffered a twisted ankle against the Foxes, but it is thought he will start alongside Roberto Firmino and Sadio Mane in attack.

(Image: Liverpool FC via Getty Images)

When asked of the trio on Friday, boss Jurgen Klopp said: "Better - how good, we have to see, that’s the truth.

“There are two more sessions to come from this afternoon and we have to see. Then we’ll make decisions, that’s how it is. Nothing is fixed.

“The players on international duty all came back healthy, which is very, very important, so we now had three or four days with the full squad to prepare it, which is a little bit comfortable at least.”

Predicted Liverpool line-up vs Man Utd: Alisson; Alexander-Arnold, Matip, van Dijk, Robertson,Henderson, Fabinho, Wijnaldum, Mane, Firmino, Salah
description: The Reds are bidding to maintain their perfect start to the Premier League season with a ninth consecutive win
